summary: The New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) is the biggest stock market globally, located in New York City. It's often called "The Big Board." The NYSE trading floor is in a historic building on Wall Street and Broad Street. The exchange is owned by Intercontinental Exchange (ICE), an American company. Many American adults invest in the stock market through stocks, mutual funds, or retirement accounts. In 2022, around 58% of U.S. adults had money in the stock market.
title: New York Stock Exchange
